modules.description: This module defines a variant type `mark_type` with three constructors: `Error`, `Warning`, and `Message`. It is used to classify different types of annotations or markers in a text editor interface, such as those displayed in an ACE editor. These values are typically used to indicate the severity or nature of a marker when highlighting or processing source code.

This module initializes and configures text editor instances, supporting dynamic content manipulation through operations like setting text, managing selections, and applying styles. It integrates with DOM elements and uses positional ranges, document tokens, and severity-based markers to enable rich editing features such as real-time syntax highlighting and error annotation. The `mark_type` variant—comprising `Error`, `Warning`, and `Message`—classifies markers for visual feedback, allowing editors to display and process annotations based on severity. Examples include embedding code editors in web apps, highlighting syntax elements, and marking linting errors inline with specific marker types.

This module provides the core functionality for creating and managing text editor instances with rich editing features. It supports dynamic content manipulation through operations like setting text, managing selections, and applying styles, while integrating directly with DOM elements. Key data types include positional ranges, document tokens, and the `mark_type` variant (`Error`, `Warning`, `Message`) for annotating and visually distinguishing content. It enables use cases such as embedding code editors, real-time syntax highlighting, and inline error marking based on severity.
